question: What should I require to be an eligible Veteran?
scenario: I am a military member just got out of the military, and I want to know if I am eligible.
answer: You have an Honorable Discharge, and you have a High School Diploma (or equivalent) - or 12 hours of college credit, and you meet the requirements under one of the four categories, listed on the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) Montgomery GI Bill Active Duty page.
snippet:
You may be an eligible Veteran if:

* You have an Honorable Discharge, and
* You have a High School Diploma (or equivalent) - or 12 hours of college credit, and
* You meet the requirements under one of the four categories, listed on the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) Montgomery GI Bill Active Duty page

question: How much can I apply for repair or replace my residence?
scenario: I own a house and I need money to renovate. That house is my primary residence for legal.

history.follow_up_question: Has your primary residence suffered from substantial disaster damange?
Has your primary residence been covered by insurance?

evidence.follow_up_question: Is your residence primary?

snippet: Homeowners may apply for up to $200,000 to repair or replace their primary residence to its pre-disaster condition. The loan may not be used to upgrade the home or make additions to it, unless as required by building authority/code. In some cases, SBA may be able to refinance all or part of a previous mortgage (not to exceed $200,000) when the applicant does not have credit available elsewhere, has suffered substantial disaster damage not covered by insurance, and intends to repair the damage. SBA considers refinancing when processing each application. Loans may also be increased by as much as 20 percent of the verified losses (not to exceed $200,000) to protect the damaged real property from possible future disasters of the same kind. Secondary homes or vacation properties are not eligible for home disaster loans; however, qualified rental properties may be eligible for assistance under the business disaster loan program.

question: Why can't I export products made from this animal according to special rules?
answer: Are they for scientific research, if they’re family heirlooms or valuable artworks?
snippet:
#  Export products made from endangered animals: special rules

There are special rules for products made with elephant ivory, rhino horn, tigers and their parts and derivatives, bear bile, bear paws and gallbladders, and eggs of native British birds. They can only be exported in special cases like for scientific research, if they’re family heirlooms or valuable artworks.

answer: Are you deferring your Stare Pension and building up extra amount?

## Extra money from deferring your State Pension

If you decided to defer your State Pension and built up an extra amount, your spouse or civil partner may either claim the extra State Pension or get a lump sum. Provided they haven’t remarried or formed a new civil partnership since your death they can get this when they reach State Pension age.

snippet:
#  Export products made from endangered animals: special rules

If animal is classed as Annex A, you must apply for an Article 10 certificate unless any of the following apply:

* you’re using or displaying goods for non-commercial reasons like scientific research or in an educational display

question: Why isn't this loan suitable for me as a homeowner?
scenario: My home was not affected by a disaster. I work for an employer in Switzerland. I am approved to use Centrepay.
answer: Your home has to be affected by a disaster.

evidence.follow_up_question: Was your home affected by a disaster?

snippet: Homeowners may apply for up to $200,000 to repair or replace their primary residence to its pre-disaster condition. The loan may not be used to upgrade the home or make additions to it, unless as required by building authority/code. In some cases, SBA may be able to refinance all or part of a previous mortgage (not to exceed $200,000) when the applicant does not have credit available elsewhere, has suffered substantial disaster damage not covered by insurance, and intends to repair the damage. SBA considers refinancing when processing each application. Loans may also be increased by as much as 20 percent of the verified losses (not to exceed $200,000) to protect the damaged real property from possible future disasters of the same kind. Secondary homes or vacation properties are not eligible for home disaster loans; however, qualified rental properties may be eligible for assistance under the business disaster loan program.

question: Why is this loan suitable for me as a homeowner?

history.follow_up_question: Was your home affected by a disaster?

evidence.follow_up_question: Is this loan for your primary residence?

snippet: Homeowners may apply for up to $200,000 to repair or replace their primary residence to its pre-disaster condition. The loan may not be used to upgrade the home or make additions to it, unless as required by building authority/code. In some cases, SBA may be able to refinance all or part of a previous mortgage (not to exceed $200,000) when the applicant does not have credit available elsewhere, has suffered substantial disaster damage not covered by insurance, and intends to repair the damage. SBA considers refinancing when processing each application. Loans may also be increased by as much as 20 percent of the verified losses (not to exceed $200,000) to protect the damaged real property from possible future disasters of the same kind. Secondary homes or vacation properties are not eligible for home disaster loans; however, qualified rental properties may be eligible for assistance under the business disaster loan program.

In some cases, SBA may be able to refinance all or part of a previous mortgage (not to exceed $200,000) when the applicant does not have credit available elsewhere, has suffered substantial disaster damage not covered by insurance, and intends to repair the damage. SBA considers refinancing when processing each application. Loans may also be increased by as much as 20 percent of the verified losses (not to exceed $200,000) to protect the damaged real property from possible future disasters of the same kind. Secondary homes or vacation properties are not eligible for home disaster loans; however, qualified rental properties may be eligible for assistance under the business disaster loan program.

question: What should I register as?
scenario: I am a business and I work in the voluntary sector
answer: intermediary organisation

history.follow_up_question: Did you work in the voluntary sector and act for many people?

snippet:
## If you act for a lot of clients

Write to the Tax Credit Office to register as an ‘intermediary organisation’ if you work in the voluntary sector and act for many people.

question: If  my products are made from animal classed as Annex A, what certificate do I need to apply?
scenario: My company export products made from endangered animals. Most of our buyers are collectors. I am going to apply for a certificate for special rules.
answer: an Article 10 certificate

history.follow_up_question: Are your goods antiques made before 1947?
Are you giving your goods away?

evidence.follow_up_question: Are you using or displaying goods for non-commercial reasons like scientific research or in an educational display?

snippet:
#  Export products made from endangered animals: special rules

If animal is classed as Annex A, you must apply for an Article 10 certificate unless any of the following apply:

* your goods are antiques made before 1947
* you’re giving your goods away
* you’re using or displaying goods for non-commercial reasons like scientific research or in an educational display

question: What products made from endangered animals can't be exported?
scenario: I am an antique collector and I want to sell my antiques abroad. But some of them are made from endangered animals.
answer: family heirlooms or valuable artworks
snippet:
#  Export products made from endangered animals: special rules

There are special rules for products made with elephant ivory, rhino horn, tigers and their parts and derivatives, bear bile, bear paws and gallbladders, and eggs of native British birds. They can only be exported in special cases like for scientific research, if they’re family heirlooms or valuable artworks.

question: What will happen to my SMP?
scenario: I am pregnant and I am having a little trouble during my pregnancy. I stole a bottle of wine from the supermarket and was arrested by the police.
answer: You can’t get SMP

evidence.follow_up_question: Did you go into police custody during your maternity pay period?

snippet:
## Statutory Maternity Pay

You can’t get SMP if you go into police custody during your maternity pay period. It won’t restart when you’re discharged.

question: Why can I apply zero VAT to this item?
scenario: I do sell fuel. No, I have paid all of my debts on time.
answer: You are selling lifeboats and associated equipment, including fuel.

history.follow_up_question: Is it equipment for making ‘talking’ books and newspapers?

evidence.follow_up_question: Are you selling lifeboats and associated equipment, including fuel?

snippet:
## Items that qualify for the zero rate

You may be able to apply zero VAT when you sell the following to an eligible charity:

* equipment for making ‘talking’ books and newspapers
* lifeboats and associated equipment, including fuel
* medicine or ingredients for medicine
* resuscitation training models

question: What can't I export?
scenario: I am a zoologist and I want to take animal products abroad.
answer: Species+ says the animal is banned.
snippet:
#  Export products made from endangered animals: special rules

If Species+ says the animal is banned, you can’t export the product. There are special rules for ivory, rhino horn and certain other animal products.

question: What form should I use to get authorisation from my client?
scenario: I am an agent working in a special field, and I need a formal document authorization to secure the interests of both parties.
answer: Are you a paid agent?

history.follow_up_question: Do you act for a lot of clients?

snippet:
## If you act for a lot of clients

Use form 64-8 to get authorisation if you’re a paid agent. You can then use the Agent Priority Line to contact the Tax Credit Office.

question: Why can't I send form TC689 to the Tax Credit Office to get authorised?
scenario: I have the form in front of me.  I signed it myself.  It does have my client's name on it though.
answer: It must be signed by the person (or persons if it’s a joint claim) you’re representing.

evidence.follow_up_question: Is it signed by the person or person you are representing?

snippet:
## Get authorised

Send form TC689 to the Tax Credit Office. This must be signed by the person (or persons if it’s a joint claim) you’re representing.

question: Why don't I qualify for SMP?
scenario: I just started to work for this pervy guy selling cell phone cases at the mall about three months ago, my baby is due in about two months and on top of it my claim for maternity pay was turned down this week so I have to appeal that apparently, my life is just falling apart at the seams.
answer: Did you give the correct notice?

history.follow_up_question: Do you earn on average at least £113 a week?

snippet:
## Statutory Maternity Pay

To qualify for SMP you must:

* earn on average at least £113 a week
* give the correct notice
* give proof you’re pregnant
* have worked for your employer continuously for at least 26 weeks continuing into the ‘qualifying week’ - the 15th week before the expected week of childbirth
